TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed PeekAction extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Indicates whether to peek the current message in a queue, or the next message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Messaging.PeekAction> enumeration with <xref:System.Messaging.MessageQueue.BeginPeek%28System.TimeSpan%2CSystem.Messaging.Cursor%2CSystem.Messaging.PeekAction%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%29> and <xref:System.Messaging.MessageQueue.Peek%28System.TimeSpan%2CSystem.Messaging.Cursor%2CSystem.Messaging.PeekAction%29> to indicate whether you want to peek at the current message in the queue, or the next message.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.PeekAction Current = int32(-2147483648)

Docs.summary: Peek at the current message in the queue.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Messaging.PeekAction Next = int32(-2147483647)

Docs.summary: Peek at the next message in the queue.
